column4: Hi *. I have a very weird problem. A file is not recognized as an image if it has an extension (such as .jpeg, or .jpg). Does anyone know why?
maybe it is not an image file?  use this to find out.   file -i /path/to/file
it is
what does file return there?
Lake.jpg: JPEG image data, JFIF standard 1.01
hmm, did you run that under   file -i  image.jpeg?
Lake.jpg: image/jpeg
what shall I blame for this... gnome or gtk?
hmm, very strange .. you could use convert (part of the imagemagick package) to perhaps, repair the jpeg.  convert image.jpeg new_image.jpeg
well, it could just be that the jpeg is corrupted
well we are talking about thousands of files
including those that are downloaded from the internet
what program are you using to view the files?
well at the moment I am just trying to get them as background images...
hmm, well, do they open up fine in gthumb and/or eog ?
sorry... eog works fine
hmm, not sure then -- i don't use gnome to be able help you with this
yes they do
at the minimum ..  u+rw  with your user being the owner
it still doesn't work
if i erase .thumbnails, nautilius wouldn't recreate it
i'm not very good with nautilus .. i don't use it or gnome
ok... thanks anyway
